name: Mercure Sydney

reviews.text: Stayed in the Mercure in Sydney in August 2009.
reviews.title: Good location, good value!

reviews.text: It's in a good location, right by central station so it's easy to get around. I found I walked to most places, even up to the harbour didn't take too long. There are plenty of places to eat and convenience stores in the area.
reviews.title: Cheap but comfortable

reviews.text: The rooms were a decent size and very clean. There was also a fridge which was useful. The TV was pretty big and had a good selection of channels.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.....

reviews.text: Used the hotel pool once which was very small but clean.
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel. Would not recommend to anyone.

reviews.text: The thai restaurant/bar next to the lobby is great, lovely food at a decent price and they have a happy hour with cheap wine and beer!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: The hotel has the usual things one needs, but nothing outstanding. A few things I don't like though:
reviews.title: Average stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - housekeeping knocking on my door at 8am asking whether he could clean the room. I was still waiting for my breakfast to be delivered so I said no. I thought it a bit odd though.
reviews.title: Not quite what we thought

reviews.text: - housekeeper didn't clean my cups but left a note explaining that he/she wasn't sure whether i was still using it. Again, a strange experience for me.
reviews.title: the best birthday present ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - no in-room minibar. There is a small fridge in the room but contains except milk for tea. Instead, drinks etc are offerred via vendor machines in the corridor which require a smart card to operate. Apparently this card is provided to guests upon check-in. I wasn't offerred one.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel
Nice hotel
reviews.text: -Had room service for breakfast but food was below average.

reviews.title: Very Disappointed
reviews.text: Allowed to check in early on arrival from Airport, much appreciated, great start to holiday but from there on, things went downhill. View from room of a big black hoarding and we were on 10th Floor. Queued for Breakfast first morning 15 Minutes then allocated a table, went to Buffet bar came back to find table allocated to another couple.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The purpose of our visit was to try to locate my wife's relatives who she had lost contact with in 1996. My wife is Chinese, and I did not realise how many Chinese (Asian) people there were in Sydney. On the Friday we started our search and due to a very helpful Taxi Driver who took us to the only address we had, where due we spoke to the mother of the couple who had puchased the house from a Chinese Lady, but her daughter was away on business but she would give her the message when she returned on Sunday/Monday. Lo and behold on Sunday we received a phone call from the cousin and consequently we had a very enjoyable time with her Aunty and 3 Cousins for the remainder of our stay, Eldest cousin actually took us to the Airport for our flight home.
reviews.title: Just Right

reviews.text: So even though the Hotel did not live up to our expectations the holiday was a sucess in every other way. But now to the Hotel,
reviews.title: Excellent Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping - Had to request top up of Beverages in room (tea & Milk) 3 out of 7 days, reception very good, had replenishments up to room in under 10 mins (we were on 10th Floor). Went out on 4th day at 9.30a.m. returned to room at 10.30p.m. to find room not cleaned or made up. Asking for Night Duty Manager, very nice and efficient, had room made up within 30 mins, defused my annoyance very efficiently but should not have happened.
reviews.title: Served a purpose but lacked that extra something

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following day saw Hotel Manager who stated room had a notice on door saying not to make up room, but room next door had notice on door but not ours. Why not have a 'Make up Room' Notice? When commenting about room view, told in no uncertain terms that to have city view is about 50 AUD extra, we only booked a standard room!
reviews.title: Convenient, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here as part of honeymoon, we had some plush 5 star hotels and some 4 star, as on a world trip. Our hotels were organised witha agent.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

reviews.text: From the brochure the hotel looked much better....i was disapointed with our room.
reviews.title: recommend to all

reviews.text: They gave us a smoking room, we dont smoke, it smelt terrible.
reviews.title: Always reliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service, house keeping was not as good as expected.
reviews.title: very bad housekeeper

reviews.text: The hotel bar was closed one night for bank holiday...the bar upstairs closed at 10pm!!?? we were told "theres a bar across the street"...not very professional for a hotel whether it be a bank holiday or not, you would never get a bar close at that time in the UK or USA.
reviews.title: A welcome relief

description: Mercure Sydney's convenient location is the perfect place from which to explore Sydney's major attractions, making it the perfect choice when travelling for both business and leisure. Boasting 517 modern contemporary accommodation rooms over 14 floors, these rooms have been designed for guests requiring a combination of convenience and comfort. Unique facilities include 24-hour room service, 24-hour indoor rooftop swimming pool, gym with air-conditioning, sauna, 2 restaurants and secure parking.
